sense.name: Draw advantages from; take advantage.
sense.examples: Sales climbed 71% to $6.36 billion from $3.72 billion as the company capitalized on the ravenous global demand for commercial airliners. He is capitalizing on her mistake. She capitalized on his absence and met her lover.

sense.name: Write in capital letters.
sense.examples: Children often capitalize when they aren't supposed to. I capitalized all of the letters to make my writing clearer.

sense.name: Supply with capital, as of a business by using a combination of capital used by investors and debt capital provided by lenders.
sense.examples: He capitalized his friend's business venture, allowing him to open the three stores planned.

sense.name: Compute the value of a business or an income.
sense.examples: I capitalized GM's market value yesterday.

sense.name: Consider expenditures as capital assets rather than expenses.
sense.examples: If we capitalize expense of building the oil rig, then we can consider it a long term company asset.

sense.name: Convert (a company's reserve funds) into capital.
sense.examples: A company can capitalize some of its company stock to start a second building.
